repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

physdesc.extent: 1 record carton and one document box

did.abstract: This collection contains records of Tufts theater productions, created or compiled by William Northrop Morse and dating primarily from his time as a professor at Tufts from 1928 to 1934. Materials in this collection include student theater programs from Pens, Paint, and Pretzels (3Ps) and other student organizations, newspaper clippings, photos from a 1928 3Ps production of Emperor Jones, and copies of the Tufts Weekly.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains records of Tufts theater productions, compiled by William Northrop Morse and dating primarily from his time as a theater professor at Tufts from 1928 to 1935. It includes 4 volumes of scrapbooks; clippings from Tufts publications concerning Tufts theater productions; photos from a 1928 Pen, Paint, and Pretzels (3Ps) production of Emperor Jones; programs from Tufts theater and 3Ps productions; and copies of the Tufts Weekly. Scrapbooks include newspaper clippings, Tufts theater production programs, William Northrop Morse's professional correspondence, and other materials related to Tufts theater and Morse's involvement with Tufts theater.

Materials in this collection pertain to student theater productions written, directed, or otherwise assisted by Morse. These productions involve students from Tufts and Jackson College and were produced by the 3Ps, The Masque Society (Jackson's dramatic society), and other Tufts-affiliated departments and societies, including the Tufts Graduate Dramatic Society and the English Department's playwriting course.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: William Northrop Morse (1882-1977) was a professor of dramatic literature at Tufts College from 1928 to 1935. At Tufts, he wrote, directed, and assisted in student theater productions, including those produced by the Pen, Paint, and Pretzels (3Ps), The Masque Society (Jackson College's dramatic society), and course-related productions.

William Northrop Morse was born in Amherst, Massachusetts on May 22, 1882 to Anson D. Morse, a history professor at Amherst College, and Margaret D. Morse. After graduating from Phillips Academy in 1900, he received his B.A. from Amherst in 1904. He received his A.M. from Harvard in 1905 and spent time at Harvard Graduate School from 1921-1923 and 1924-1926.

He served as an instructor and director of dramatics at Washington University from 1923 to 1924 before becoming an associate professor at Middlebury in 1926 and professor in 1927. While at Middlebury, he supervised and directed student productions from the college's student dramatic club.

In 1928, Morse became a Professor of Dramatic Literature at Tufts. While at Tufts, he taught play production and continued his support of student theater through his involvement in Tufts College's dramatic society, Pen, Paint, and Pretzels (3Ps), and Jackson College's dramatic society, the Masque Society, before its merge with the 3Ps in 1930. During this time, he directed and assisted in student productions from the 3Ps, the Masque Society, and other Tufts affiliated groups and departments, including the Tufts Graduate Dramatic Society and the English Department's playwriting course. Student productions included Morse's own original works. He taught at Tufts until 1935.

After his time at Tufts, Morse taught at Middlesex University in Waltham, Massachusetts and Mount Ida Junior College in Newton, Massachusetts before retiring to become a freelance writer, residing in Newton Highlands, Massachusetts. He died in 1977 at the age of 95.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in alphabetical order.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Any intellectual property rights that the donor possesses have been transferred to Tufts University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Jane Bower, 2022, accession number MS-2022-069.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: William Northrop Morse Papers, 1928 -- 1935. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Kaycee Conover, archives assistant, in Fall 2022. Materials were placed in archival boxes and folders and arranged in alphabetical order where appplicable. A moldy back cover and blank page were excised from the end of the 1928-1930 scrapbook by Collections Management Archivist Adrienne Pruitt to prevent spread and further damage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Predominantly Tufts Weekly clippings, but also includes theater and Tufts theater-related clippings from local newspapers such as the Wincester Star and the New York Times as well as notices from William Northrop Morse advertising for upcoming Tufts theater productions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also includes one photograph from what appears to be a production of Hamlet.
